result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus M Ortega

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesus M Ortega appeared by video.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by video for Jesus M Ortega.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Final Pretrial Conference.  Defense counsel advises Court that he will be in trial in another court and unable to proceed with trial.  Additionally, defense counsel advises Court that defendant wants to hire private counsel.  Court vacates previously scheduled jury trial date.  Defense counsel requests bail motion at next court hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Status Conference held.  Court will schedule case for final pretrial conference date.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/7/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Copeland has just been appointed and has not received discovery or an offer and would like a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.
Defendant's Motion for Bail Modification.  (Jesus M. Ortega - #2022001305, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AML or her children.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jesus M Ortega in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Jesus M Ortega in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesus M Ortega appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised hat due to lower pending matters, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
